bibl.title: The Mummy of the 'Embroideress', the Textiles and the Other Contents of her Grave Preserved in the Royal Museums of Art and History in Brussels. Avec résumés en français et en néerlandais.
bibl.note: Royal Museums of Art and History (Brussels) Inv. E. 1019 to 1047. - Acquisition at the Guimet auction in 1901 and identification of the objects. - Exhibition and study in the RMAH. - Conclusions. The so-called embroideress Euphemia lived (in Antinoë?) most probably in the late 5th or in the 6th century AD.
bibl.seg: VAN RAEMDONCK Mieke, The Mummy of the 'Embroideress', the Textiles and the Other Contents of her Grave Preserved in the Royal Museums of Art and History in Brussels. Avec résumés en français et en néerlandais.

Royal Museums of Art and History (Brussels) Inv. E. 1019 to 1047. - Acquisition at the Guimet auction in 1901 and identification of the objects. - Exhibition and study in the RMAH. - Conclusions. The so-called embroideress Euphemia lived (in Antinoë?) most probably in the late 5th or in the 6th century AD.
